subsc: General industry and trade sector,Crops,Banking,General public administration sector,Health
trustfund:
TF050290-THIRD ECONOMIC REFORM SUPPORT
            OPERATION - GHANA,TF026516-PHRD-GHANA: ECONOMIC REFORM
            SUPPORT OPERATION III

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Economic Reform Support
            Operation Credit Project aims at supporting macroeconomic
            stability, and market confidence towards the development of
            the Government's reform agenda for accelerated growth,
            and poverty reduction, through a broad-based consultative
            process with civil society, and stakeholders. Governance,
            and macroeconomic stability will be restored by: 1) reducing
            the domestic, and foreign debt, through curtailed fiscal
            deficit, and seeking debt relief under the enhanced Heavily
            Indebted Poor Countries (HIPC) Initiative; 2) strengthening
            the management, and control of public expenditures; and, 3)
            eliminating the deficit of key public enterprises. Moreover,
            the reform process will be reinvigorated in the areas of
            budgetary management, public enterprise divestiture, banking
            sector, and cocoa export marketing, and in addition, the
            country's Poverty Reduction Strategy will be prepared,
            and implemented within a broad participatory process. These
            actions will stimulate private sector growth, and lead to
            fiscal adjustments, needed for increasing expenditures for
            poverty reduction, in addition to improvements in producer
            prices for cocoa farmers, and the liberalization of export
            marketing. Nonetheless, risks include political weaknesses,
            capacity constraints, and, vulnerability to trade shocks;
            however, the new Government's commitment to the reform
            agenda, to increase implementation capacity, and, a strong
            donor support will substantially mitigate those risks.
